member.summary:
Parse the command line arguments based on the following syntax:
[-argument[:optional-value]] [-argument[:optional-value]]

member.summary: Check if an argument of the name given was part of the supplied arguments

member.summary: Get the the value of a named argument

member.returns: the value supplied by an argument

member.summary: Get the number of extracted arguments

member.name: T:OpenCover.Framework.ExcludeFromCoverageAttribute
member.summary: This attribute can be used to hide code whilst testing

member.name: T:OpenCover.Framework.IFilter
member.summary: A filter that is used to decide whether an assembly/class pair is instrumented

member.name: M:OpenCover.Framework.IFilter.AddFilter(System.String)
member.summary: Add a filter
member.param:
A filter is of the format (+ or -)[assemblyName]className, wildcards are allowed.
i.e. -[mscorlib], -[System.*]*, +[App.*]*, +[*]*

member.name: M:OpenCover.Framework.IFilter.UseAssembly(System.String)
member.summary: Decides whether an assembly should be included in the instrumentation
member.param: the name of the assembly under profile
member.returns: the name of the class under profile
member.remarks: All assemblies matching either the inclusion or exclusion filter should be included as it is the class that is being filtered within these unless the class filter is *

member.name: M:OpenCover.Framework.IFilter.InstrumentClass(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determine if an [assemblyname]classname pair matches the current Exclusion or Inclusion filters
member.param: the name of the assembly under profile
the name of the class under profile
member.returns: false - if pair matches the exclusion filter or matches no filters, true - if pair matches in the inclusion filter

member.name: M:OpenCover.Framework.IFilter.AddAttributeExclusionFilters(System.String[])
member.summary: Add attribute exclusion filters
member.param: An array of filters that are used to wildcard match an attribute

member.name: M:OpenCover.Framework.IFilter.ExcludeByAttribute(Mono.Cecil.ICustomAttributeProvider)
member.summary: Is this entity excluded due to an attributeFilter
member.param: The entity to test

member.name: M:OpenCover.Framework.IFilter.ExcludeByFile(System.String)
member.summary: Is this file excluded
member.param: The name of the file to test

member.name: M:OpenCover.Framework.IFilter.AddFileExclusionFilters(System.String[])
member.summary: Add file exclusion filters

member.name: T:OpenCover.Framework.FilterType
member.summary: The type of filter, an exclusion filter takes precedence over inclusion filter

member.name: F:OpenCover.Framework.FilterType.Inclusion
member.summary: The filter is an inclusion type, i.e. if a assembly/class pair matches the filter then it is included for instrumentation

member.name: F:OpenCover.Framework.FilterType.Exclusion
member.summary: The filter is an exclusion type, i.e. if a assembly/class pair matches the filter then it is excluded for instrumentation

member.name: T:OpenCover.Framework.Filter
member.summary: A filter that is used to decide whether an assembly/class pair is instrumented

member.summary: Standard constructor

member.name: T:OpenCover.Framework.ProfilerRegistration
member.summary: Used to register and unregister the profiler
member.remarks: Intentionally not unit tested - as this is calling regsvr32 which does what it does and does not need more testing from me

member.summary: Register the profiler using %SystemRoot%\system\regsvr32.exe
member.param: true - user the /n /i:user switches

member.param: true - user the /n /i:user switches
